dt: {bc}to take control of a people or area especially as an extension of state power

dt.t: It [Aléria, France] was, at different times in history, {wi}colonized{/wi} by the Greeks, Etruscans, Carthaginians, and Romans.
Pacific Islanders—Hawaiians, Samoans, the Chamorro of Guam—were and remain {wi}colonized{/wi} by the United States …
Before the U.S.'s occupation of the roughly 7,500 islands, Spain {wi}colonized{/wi} the Philippines and Mexico concurrently for around 300 years …
As the indigenous people of North America, Native Americans were {wi}colonized{/wi} on their own land, the places to which they trace their social, cultural, and religious origins.

dt: {bc}to migrate to and settle in (an inhabited or uninhabited area)

dt.t: the areas of New England {wi}colonized{/wi} by the Puritans
… the seaside town of Puerto Madryn, named by the Welsh settlers who {wi}colonized{/wi} the few river valleys of Patagonia.

dt: {bc}to spread to and develop in a new area or habitat

dt.t: … usually the first plant to {wi}colonize{/wi} newly formed sand spits and newly deposited sands on the barrier islands …

dt: {bc}to multiply in or on a host or an inanimate object or surface

dt.t: {d_link|C. diff.|C. diff} is a spore-forming, toxin-producing bacterium that can {wi}colonize{/wi} the large intestine and wreak havoc there …
… the bacteria that {wi}colonize{/wi} our gut and play a key role in keeping us healthy.
Microorganisms, particularly normal skin flora, {wi}colonize{/wi} and form biofilms quickly on catheter surfaces …

dt: {bc}to take or make use of (something) without authority or right {bc}{sx|appropriate||}

dt.t: Parked cars have {wi}colonized{/wi} city streets for so long that most people assume cars own the curb lane.

"Before {wi}colonizing{/wi} the artistic and intellectual work of Black people, white people should ask themselves questions such as, how can I contribute to this Black person's wellbeing? Am I studying this work for the explicit purpose of Black liberation, or are my motives fundamentally selfish?"

shortdef: to take control of a people or area especially as an extension of state power
to migrate to and settle in (an inhabited or uninhabited area)
to spread to and develop in a new area or habitat
